intro: Kibara formicarum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and thrives in well-draining soil with moderate light exposure. Its foliage is often velvety and dark green, while the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, blue, and white. Kibara formicarum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
